Package com.gsm.service.impl

Class CustomerServiceImpl

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.gsm.service.impl.CustomerServiceImpl
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    CustomerService
    @Service
public class CustomerServiceImpl
extends java.lang.Object
implements CustomerService
    The concrete implementation of the CustomerService interface. This class orchestrates all business logic for the Customer feature, including parsing and saving data from Excel files.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      private CustomerRepository customerRepository  
      private org.apache.poi.ss.usermodel.DataFormatter dataFormatter
      DataFormatter is a utility from Apache POI to safely retrieve the formatted string value of a cell, regardless of its underlying data type.

    • Method Detail

      • parseExcelForPreview

        public java.util.List<Customer> parseExcelForPreview​(java.io.InputStream inputStream)
                                              throws java.io.IOException
        Parses an Excel file from an input stream into a list of Customer objects without persisting them to the database. This is used for data preview.
        Specified by:
        parseExcelForPreview in interface CustomerService
        Parameters:
        inputStream - The input stream of the .xlsx file to be parsed.
        Returns:
        A List of Customer objects parsed from the file.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an error occurs during file reading.

      • saveAll

        @Transactional
public void saveAll​(java.util.List<Customer> customers)
        Saves a list of Customer objects to the database using an "upsert" logic. If a customer with the same code exists, it will be updated. Otherwise, a new customer will be created.
        Specified by:
        saveAll in interface CustomerService
        Parameters:
        customers - The list of Customer objects to be saved.

      • getCellValueAsString

        private java.lang.String getCellValueAsString​(org.apache.poi.ss.usermodel.Cell cell)
        Safely reads a cell's value and returns it as a String, regardless of the cell type. This prevents "Cannot get a STRING value from a NUMERIC cell" errors.
        Parameters:
        cell - The Excel cell to read from. Can be null.
        Returns:
        The cell's content as a trimmed String. Returns an empty string if the cell is null.
